name: passkey
content:
passkey noun [C]
(KEY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(also pass key) a key that can be used to open any of several different locks: The building manager gave him a passkey to the apartment. The FBI agents who'd been watching her used a pass key to open her room. Synonym
master key
a method that a computer uses to know who you are, for example by recognizing your finger or face, rather than needing a password (= a secret combination of words or numbers) to be entered: Choose the headset or device on your phone and use a passkey or PIN. The wizard allows you to choose a passkey for any connected Bluetooth device.
More examplesFewer examplesThe night porter used a passkey for those rooms that were empty or where no one answered.During the fire, building managers gave firefighters a ring full of pass keys.It may also ask you for a passkey if you have never paired the devices before.
